problem_text:
Suppose that a finite group G has the same spectrum as an alternating group. Is it true that G has at most one non-abelian composition factor?
For any finite simple group other than alternating the answer to the corresponding question is affirmative (mod CFSG).
A. V. Vasil’ev and V. D. Mazurov
answer: Yes, it is (I. B. Gorshkov, Algebra and Logic, 52, no. 1 (2013), 41–45).
